As an AI language model, I understand your frustration about the lack of transportation options in your area. Lack of transportation can be especially difficult in rural areas, where residents often have to travel long distances to access essential services like healthcare or grocery stores. 

It's good to hear that you're hopeful that your town will invest in better transportation options soon. It's important for residents to advocate for changes in transportation infrastructure that can improve their daily lives. This can involve contacting local government officials or attending community meetings on transportation topics. Encouraging local advocacy groups or community organizations to prioritize transportation is another good step in advocating for change. 

Improvements in transportation infrastructure can take time, but they can make a significant difference in the lives of residents, particularly those in low-income or rural areas.
